content.question: Which of the following explains why an alloy of <math alttext="A u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="A g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> conducts electricity?

choices.label: <math alttext="A g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> typically forms only <math alttext="A g with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions, whereas <math alttext="A u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> forms both <math alttext="A u positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="A u positive 3 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions.

<math alttext="A u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a larger atomic radius than <math alttext="A g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, so its electrons are easier to remove.

Both <math alttext="A g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="A u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have delocalized valence electrons.

Both <math alttext="A g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="A u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> attract shared electrons equally.

content.answer: Both <math alttext="A g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="A u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have delocalized valence electrons.
